Laboratory monitoring reveals esomeprazole can cause significant magnesium deficiency over time.
Case reports document severe hypomagnesemia requiring IV replacement in esomeprazole users.
FDA safety communications specifically warn about esomeprazole-induced hypomagnesemia risks.
Systematic reviews establish esomeprazole as a significant cause of magnesium depletion.
